intro: Macrocarpaea dolichophylla, commonly known as the long-leaf macrocarpa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. Its roots are valued for their medicinal properties, often used in traditional Māori medicine. Macrocarpaea dolichophylla thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas.
